channel.title: Spring
channel.description: Level up your Java code and explore what Spring can do for you.

item.title: Spring Modulith 1.4.2 and 1.3.8 released
item.dc:creator: odrotbohm
item.content:encoded:
I am pleased to announce the availability of Spring Modulith 1.4.2 and 1.3.8. The releases contain the usual dependency upgrades to the latest Spring Boot and Framework versions.

1.4.2 ships with more detailed application module metadata generated into application-modules.json (either with our AOT support enabled during the build or via the documentation generated through the Documenter API). This has enabled our friends at Sonargraph, a tool to logically define application architectures and perform advanced exploration and verification, to build integration for Spring Modulith applications. As described in their announcing blog post, they now support creating an architecture definition by picking up the structure defined in you application when importing a Spring Modulith project.

Find more details about the releases in the full changelogs for 1.3.8 and 1.4.2.

item.title: A Bootiful Podcast: José Paumard, Java developer advocate and professor
item.dc:creator: joshlong
item.content:encoded: Hi, Spring fans! In this installment, recorded at Devoxx UK 2025, I talk to the legendary professor of computer science and legend José Paumard about Java, the ecosystem, and more,

item.title: Spring Boot 4.0.0-M1 available now
item.dc:creator: philwebb
item.content:encoded:
On behalf of the team and everyone who has contributed, I'm happy to announce that Spring Boot 4.0.0-M1 has been released and is now available from Maven Central!!

This release includes is the first milestone of the 4.x generation and is the first release including our efforts to modularize the codebase. It is also the first milestone that we are publishing to Maven central.

Please see the release notes and the draft migration guide for more details and upgrade instructions.

We are particularly interested in getting early feedback on the new modular design and hearing about any upgrade problems that you encounter. Issues can be raised on the GitHub project page.

Thanks to all those who have contributed to this release.

How can you help?

If you're interested in helping out, check out the "ideal for contribution" tag in the issue repository. If you have general questions, please ask on stackoverflow.com using the spring-boot tag.

Project Page | GitHub | Issues | Documentation | Stack Overflow

item.title: Spring Boot 3.5.4 available now
item.dc:creator: snicoll
item.content:encoded:
On behalf of the team and everyone who has contributed, I'm happy to announce that Spring Boot 3.5.4 has been released and is now available from Maven Central.

This release includes 53 bug fixes, documentation improvements, and dependency upgrades. Thanks to all those who have contributed with issue reports and pull requests.

How can you help?

If you're interested in helping out, check out the "ideal for contribution" tag in the issue repository. If you have general questions, please ask on stackoverflow.com using the spring-boot tag.

Project Page | GitHub | Issues | Documentation | Stack Overflow
